data.title: Biome information
data.intro:
Within the GSC (Genomics Standard Consortium) the Habitat-Lite effort has established a controlled vocabulary for sample sources ("Biomes"). Please help maximize the value of your data for other researchers by taking a few minutes required to add the GSC compliant metadata to your data set.

Please pick the "biome" that fits your sample best. You can use the "ontologies on the fly" approach to add additional ontology terms (please try to use existing terms as much as possible if they describe you environment).

For more information on GSC and Habitat-Lite please go to the GSC Main page.

question.name: geodetic_system
question.help: Geodetic systems or geodetic data are used in geodesy, navigation, surveying by cartographers and satellite navigation systems to translate positions indicated on their products to their real position on earth. The difference in coordinates between to reference systems is up to 140 metres (450 feet)

question.name: altitude
question.help: the height of a sampling site in relation to sea level or ground level measured in meters

name.definition: The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO6801 compliant

The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO6801 compliant

The time of sampling, either as an instance (single point in time) or interval. In case no exact time is available, the date/time can be right truncated i.e. all of these are valid times: 2008-01-23T19:23:10+00:00; 2008-01-23T19:23:10; 2008-01-23; 2008-01; 2008; Except: 2008-01; 2008 all are ISO6801 compliant
temperature measured at the time of sampling
amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling

question.name: salinity
question.info: Salinity is the saltiness or dissolved salt content of a body of water.

data.title: Sample isolation and treatment
data.intro: Please describe or give references on how the sample was isolated and the biomaterial was treated.

question.name: sampling_strategy
question.help: Depending on the workflow stage, this field is more informative in terms of cultivation-based strategies.

data.title: Project description
data.intro: Please give a short overview of the project.

data.title: Administrative Contact
data.intro: Please fill out the administrative contact information for this Metagenome
data.summary: If you have completed all of the above steps, please continue to the next step. You can review your data at any time.

data.title: Technical contact
data.intro: Please fill out the contact information for the technical contact.
data.summary: If you have completed all of the above steps, please continue to the next step. You can review your data at any time.

data.title: External IDs
data.intro: Collecting external IDs you might already have referencing your metagenome

question.name: greengenes_study_id
question.info: The id assigned by Greengenes for the study (the entitiy that NCBI calls a 'project').

step.data: >Library construction 16S rRNA-based Metadata for library construction Data provided by Todd Desantis 300

question.name: library_institute
question.info: Name of institute creating the library.

question.name: local_NAP_ids
question.info: A list of nucleic acid prep ids processed in this batch. This is the ID attached to the tube containing the purified nucleic acids.

question.name: NAP_volume
question.info: A list of volumes of nucleic acid preps used for PCR in this batch. Expressed in microliters.

question.name: local_library_ids
question.info: A list of local unique identifiers for each library as assigned by institute

question.name: forward_barcodes
question.info: A list of DNA barcodes attached to the forward primers (5´ to 3´ ) corresponding in order to NAP_ids

question.name: reverse_barcodes
question.info: A list of DNA barcodes attached to the reversed primers (5´ to 3´ ) corresponding in order to NAP_ids

question.name: forward_primer
question.info: forward primer sequence (5´ to 3´ sequence with degeneracies)

question.name: reverse_primer
question.info: forward primer sequence (5´ to 3´ sequence with degeneracies)

question.name: forward_primer_final_conc
question.info: final concentration expressed in micromolar Ex: 0.12

question.name: reverse_primer_final_conc
question.info: final concentration expressed in micromolar Ex: 0.12

question.name: amp_polymerase
question.info: The polymerase used for amplification. Compare to tail_polymerase. Also could be RT PCR if rRNA was isolated from specimen.

question.name: cycle_annealing_temp
question.info: "one or more values. Multiple values indicate touchdown PCR or Gradient PCR"

question.name: tail_temp
question.info: "Incubation temperature for tailing reaction, degrees Celsius"

question.name: tail_duration
question.info: Incubation time for tailing reaction in minutes

question.name: pcr_replicates
question.info: replicate pcr RXNs that are pooled

question.name: pcr_clean_up_methods
question.info: "Zero, one or more can be listed. Ex: column, gel, precipitation, size exclusion filtration"

question.name: pcr_clean_up_kits
question.info: Zero one or more can be list but should be in corresponding order with clean_up_methods. Ex: MoBio UltraClean PCR Clean-Up Kit

question.name: ligation_insert2vector_ratio
question.info: Molar ratio of insert to vector

question.name: host_cells
question.info: Make and model of competent cells

question.name: run_machine_id
question.info: Local identifier for sequencing machine corresponding in order to NAP_ids.

question.name: sequences_predicted_genes
question.info: Metageonme data consist of predicted genes

name.definition: force per unit area exerted against a surface by the weight of air above that surface
carbon dioxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
carbon monoxide (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

'list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. for CHEBI, see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=CHEBI'
'amount of water vapour in the air, at the time of sampling'
methane (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling

'any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here.should be given in the form of measurement name/parameter name=value and unit; can include multiple measurements or parameters'
'total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts'
oxygen (gas) amount or concentration at the time of sampling
oxygenation status of sample
'type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types'
'pollutant types and, amount or concentrations measured at the time of sampling; can report multiple pollutants by entering numeric values preceded by name of pollutant'

'concentration of substances that remain suspended in the air, and comprise mixtures of organic and inorganic substances (PM10 and PM2.5); can report multiple PM's by entering numeric values preceded by name of PM'
'salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration'
'duration for which sample was stored, e.g. 8/1/2003-7/24/2005'
'location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room'
'temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80'
the amount of solar energy that arrives at a specific area of a surface during a specific time interval
temperature of the sample at time of sampling
ventilation rate of the system in the sampled premises
ventilation system used in the sampled premises
concentration of carbon-based chemicals that easily evaporate at room temperature; can report multiple volatile organic compounds by entering numeric values preceded by name of compound
wind direction is the direction from which a wind originates
speed of wind measured at the time of sampling
'common name of the host, e.g. human'
'NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606'
'a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131'
'age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees'
description of life stage of host
physical sex of the host

'list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. for CHEBI, see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=CHEBI'

'duration for which sample was stored, e.g. 8/1/2003-7/24/2005'
'location at which sample was stored, usually name of a specific freezer/room'
'temperature at which sample was stored, e.g. -80'
concentration of silicate
concentration of sulfate
concentration of sulfide
temperature of the sample at time of sampling
'age of host at the time of sampling; relevant scale depends on species and study, e.g. could be seconds for amoebae or centuries for trees'

'information about treatment involving an exposure to varying temperatures; should include the temperature, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include different temperature regimens'

'information about treatment involving antibiotic administration; should include the name of antibiotic, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple antibiotic regimens'
'substance produced by the body, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from. for FMA (Foundational Model of Anatomy) browser see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=FMA'

'list of chemical compounds administered to the host or site where sampling occurred, and when (e.g. antibiotics, N fertilizer, air filter); can include multiple compounds. for CHEBI, see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=CHEBI'
'treatment involving use of mutagens; should include the name of mutagen, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mutagen regimens'
treatment involving an exposure to a particular climate; can include multiple climates
measurement of dry mass

'information about treatment involving the use of fertilizers; should include the name fertilizer, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fertilizer regimens'

'information about treatment involving use of fungicides; should include the name of fungicide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple fungicide regimens'

'use of conditions with differing gaseous environments; should include the name of gaseous compound, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple gaseous environment regimens'
observed genotype
'information about treatment involving use of gravity factor to study various types of responses in presence, absence or modified levels of gravity; can include multiple treatments'

'information about treatment involving use of growth hormones; should include the name of growth hormone, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple growth hormone regimens'
information about growth media for growing the plants or tissue cultured samples
measurement of height or length
'common name of the host, e.g. human'
'NCBI taxon id of the host, e.g. 9606'
taxonomic information about the host below subspecies level
'taxonomic rank information about the host below subspecies level, such as variety, form, rank etc...'
description of life stage of host
information about any mechanical damage exerted on the plant; can include multiple damages and sites

'information about treatment involving the use of mineral supplements; should include the name of mineral nutrient, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple mineral nutrient regimens'

'any other measurement performed or parameter collected, that is not listed here.should be given in the form of measurement name/parameter name=value and unit; can include multiple measurements or parameters'
'total count of any organism per gram or volume of sample,should include name of organism followed by count; can include multiple organism counts'
oxygenation status of sample
information about treatment involving exposure of plants to varying levels of pH of the growth media; can include multiple regimen
'type of perturbation, e.g. chemical administration, physical disturbance, etc., coupled with time that perturbation occurred; can include multiple perturbation types'

'information about treatment involving use of insecticides; should include the name of pesticide, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple pesticide regimens'
'phenotype of host. for PATO, see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=PATO'
name of body site that the sample was obtained from. for PO (Plant Ontology) browser see http://www.ebi.ac.uk/ontology-lookup/browse.do?ontName=PO
'substance produced by the plant, where the sample was obtained from'
information about treatment involving an exposure to a given amount of rainfall; can include multiple regimens

'information about treatment involving use of salts as supplement to liquid and soil growth media; should include the name of salt, amount administered, treatment duration, interval and total experimental duration; can include multiple salt regimens'
'salinity of sample, i.e. measure of total salt concentration'

'treatment involving an exposure to standing water during a plant's life span, types can be flood water or standing water; can include multiple regimens'

description of plant tissue culture growth media used
'total mass of the host at collection, the unit depends on host'
information about treatment involving an exposure to water with varying degree of temperature; can include multiple regimens
information about treatment involving an exposure to watering frequencies; can include multiple regimens

'vegetation classification from one or more standard classification systems, or agricultural crop'
reference or method used in vegetation classification
previous land use and dates
reference or method used in determining previous land use and dates
'whether or not crop is rotated, and if yes, rotation schedule'
'addition of fertilizers, pesticides, etc. - amount and time of applications'

'note method(s) used for tilling. values are conservation tillage or zero tillage: drill or cutting disc; reduced tillage: ridge till, strip tillage, zonal tillage, chisel or tined; conventional tillage: mouldboard or disc plough'
historical and/or physical evidence of fire
historical and/or physical evidence of flooding
unusual physical events that may have affected microbial populations
additional relevant information

'specific layer in the land area which measures parallel to the soil surface and possesses physical characteristics which differ from the layers above and beneath. values are; O horizon, A horizon, E horizon, B horizon, C horizon, R layer, Permafrost'
reference or method used in determining the horizon
collection design of pooled samples and/or sieve size and amount of sample sieved
water content (g/g or cm3/cm3)
reference or method used in determining the water content of soil
weight (g) of soil processed
were multiple DNA extractions mixed? how many?
explain how and for how long the soil sample was stored before DNA extraction.
link to climate resource
mean annual and seasonal temperature (oC)
mean annual and seasonal precipitation (mm)
link to digitized soil maps or other soil classification information
soil classification from the FAO World Reference Database for Soil Resources http://www.fao.org/ag/agl/agll/wrb/doc/wrb2007_corr.pdf
soil classification based on local soil classification system
reference or method used in determining the local soil classification
soil series name or other lower-level classification
reference or method used in determining soil series name or other lower-level classification

commonly called slope. The angle between ground surface and a horizontal line (in percent). This is the direction that overland water would flow. This measure is usually taken with a hand level meter or clinometer.
'drainage classification from a standard system such as the USDA system. possible values are; very poorly, poorly, somewhat poorly, moderately well, well, excessively drained'

'the relative proportion of different grain sizes of mineral particles in a soil, as described using a standard system; express as % sand (50 um to 2 mm), silt (2 um to 50 um), and clay (<2 um) with textural name (e.g., silty clay loam) optionsal.'
reference or method used in determining soil texture
pH measurement
reference or method used in determining pH
total organic C content of the soil units of g C/kg soil
reference or method used in determining total organic C
total nitrogen content of the soil Units of g N/kg soil
reference or method used in determining the total N

'the part of the organic matter in the soil that constitutes living microorganisms smaller than 5-10 m. IF you keep this, you would need to have correction factors used for conversion to the final units, which should be mg C (or N)/kg soil).'
reference or method used in determining microbial biomass
measured salinity
reference or method used in determining salinity
heavy metals present and concentrations
reference or method used in determining heavy metals
aluminum saturation (esp. for tropical soils)
reference or method used in determining Al saturation
